attributes.action: A referendum for England to leave to United Kingdom.
attributes.background: This is an action created in the hope that, like a Scottish independence referendum, would enable England to remain within the EU.

attributes.action: Do not allow a second referendum on the EU to take place within the next 5 years
attributes.background: The nation has spoken and the result has been determined. Let's not change the rules after the fact.

attributes.action: Protect health and pension rights  of British nationals resident in EU states.
attributes.background: The health and pension rights of British citizens living in EU states are protected by reciprocal arrangements (eg, the calculation of a person's pension based on  contributions made in more than one country); these rights must be part of any ageements negotiated during the Brexit process.

attributes.action: Enact legislation to match EU funding for areas defined as Economically Deprived
attributes.background: Legislate guaranteeing to match (and increase in line with the Retail Price Index) current EU funding for areas defined using the EU model as Economically Deprived, post exit from the EU in 2018. This to be in addition to current levels of government investment in such areas and not replacing it.
attributes.additional_details:
This is to ensure financial promises made during the Leave campaign are not forgotten and to maintain investment and growth for the populations of such Economically Deprived areas.
E.g. The total European Regional Development Fund for the 2014-2020 funding period is €3.6bn.

attributes.action: Consider The City Of London as a free independent state. Remaining in the EU
attributes.background: Following the EU referendum decision and rumours of Scotland and Ireland. The United Kingdom has become more divided than ever. It is time for London to stand alone. We ask that the government consider the feasibility of London standing alone and remaining in the EU

attributes.action: Allow UK residents to vote in parliament elections and referendums.
attributes.background: After 5 years of continuous  residence people should be allowed to vote to have an influence on changes that will affect their lifes and residence in the  UK

attributes.action: EU Referendum Rules to be made into Law that the first result stands.
attributes.background: To ensure fairplay in all referendums, the first and only vote is the one that must stand as the result. As a democratic society, any vote with a majority cannot be challenged just because some of the electorate are not happy at the result. There must be no TMO in this situation.
attributes.additional_details:
The EU referndum has been held and a majority of over 1 million voters chose the Leave option. A hardline minority of Remain campaingers have baulked at the result and are now tring to manipulate a democratic voting system by calling for a percentage ruling change. 

There is no actual evidence presented by parliament to support either option in the referendum as to the benefits or negatives of being a member of the EU. 

Any government leader that chose the remain option should now stand down.

attributes.action: Allow legal British permanent residents to vote in referendums after 5 years.
attributes.background: Not everyone living in Britain who meets the citizenship requirements wants to become a British citizen immediately. Permanent residents who have been living and working in the UK for the past 5 years should be afforded the right to vote in a referendum as it pertains to their future as well.
attributes.additional_details: A full list of citizenship requirements can be found at https://www.gov.uk/becoming-a-british-citizen/check-if-you-can-apply

attributes.action: Liverpool to hold their own referendum on leaving England.
attributes.background:
Liverpool has always felt foreign and disconnected from the rest of England. In the aftermath of England leaving the European Union and Liverpool voting to remain We should have our indepence from England. 
After all the EU had done more this city in the last 20 years than anyone in Westminster.

attributes.action: Maximum voting age for national referendums
attributes.background:
Referendum results affect the country in the long-term. Therefore, only voters that are present for the consequences of the vote should be eligible to vote.

The undersigned propose to use a limit of 15 years less than the average life expectancy.

attributes.action: Let 14-18 year olds vote in second EU referendum
attributes.background: It's their future it's affecting, let them have a say! 14-18 year olds to vote in second EU referendum!

attributes.action: Take evidence and expert advice into account alongside the EU referendum result.
attributes.background: For the reasons outlined below we the undersigned request that parliament take into consideration evidence, data and facts from a panel of academics and experts on the benefits and cons of being in the EU before making a final decision on whether or not leave.
attributes.additional_details: Reasons: The EU referendum result is advisory not legally binding; The electorate is so evenly divided; The age demographic bias towards under 50's wanting to remain a member; The impact leaving will have on future generations currently unable to vote; The inaccuracy of some claims made by campaigners; The influence of possible media bias during campaigning; Lack of expertise and insight on key issues amongst the general public.

attributes.action: Ring-fence current social service and care spending.
attributes.background: A failure to ring-fence government and local council spending on social care and services has allowed spending cuts to leave such services underfunded, and unable to meet the needs of the entire population - which can be seen in numerous failures of care for children, the elderly, and the disabled.
attributes.additional_details: Only last year adult social care regulators were reported to be receiving up to 150 reports of abuse per day - which Andrea Sutcliffe (Head of Adult Social Care) attributed to service failures, caused by underfunding. Moreover, children Trae-Bleu Layne, Rio Ross, Keanu Williams and Khyra Ishaq (four examples of many) - all died due to a lack of an organised response towards their welfare by social services - which may have been provided had funding been available to plan such a response.

attributes.action: Force retailers in airports and ports to pass on VAT/duty savings to consumers.
attributes.background: In 2015 it was exposed that many retailers in airports and ports do not pass on VAT savings to passengers travelling outside the EU and instead pocket the cash as extra profit. The government has failed to act on this issue costing consumers thousands. Retailers should pass on the full 20% saving.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-35197809

attributes.action: Make it the law for defibrillators to be at sports centres, schools, businesses
attributes.background: Earlier this year I went to a netball tournament as usual and during the match a friends mum dropped down in front of us and died, if there was a defibrillator at the sports centre she could've lived. This isn't good enough, we should go out of our way to keep lives safe. Make defibrillators the law
attributes.additional_details: Cardiac arrests and Sudden Adult Death affects everyone, no one is safe from this dreadful thing. Therefore I want to encourage all adults and young people to sign and give support to make a change!

attributes.action: Allow for the easier issuing of compulsory purchase orders by local authorities.
attributes.background: There are many towns and cities in the United Kingdom with derelict properties that are allowed to waste away unchallenged. The legal and financial implications surrounding compulsory purchase orders, which in theory should allow local authorities to stop this issue, is often an unviable option.
attributes.additional_details: The issue of land banking (which involves the purchasing of site/land/property with the sole purpose of holding onto it until its value increases) often results in sites being left to waste away for many years. Giving local authorities greater powers would put an end to this practice and in theory, ensure sites are either redeveloped or at least brought back into use more quickly.

attributes.action: Remove ethics questions from science exams at all levels of education.
attributes.background: For most people ethics are easy, but for psychopaths they are often an ungraspable concept. This does not make them evil, most psychopaths are just disadvantaged and live peacefully otherwise. However, I feel it is unfair to put a minority at such a disadvantage purely because of how they were born.
attributes.additional_details: Psychopaths are a relatively large minority in the UK, which means that a significant quantity of students are completely unable to answer questions regarding ethics through no fault fo their own. I feel that this is discrimination against certain people and should be changed to give them a fair chance at an exam just like anybody else. Exams are vital to success in later life and being put at a disadvantage just because the exam board doesn't consider everyone is very unfair in my opinion.

attributes.action: Award allied military veterans an honour 70 years after their conflict finishes.
attributes.background: France has been awarding the Chevalier in the Ordre de la Légion d’Honneur, equivalent to a British MBE, to veterans 70 years after a conflict finishes. As our veterans are now effectively ambassadors to the younger generations, British and allied veterans should be recognized in similar fashion.
attributes.additional_details:
Grand Chancery of the Legion of Honor 
http://www.legiondhonneur.fr/en

The application for the Legion D’Honneur for British Veterans
https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/d-day-70-application-form-for-award-of-the-legion-dhonneur

British Legion press release: LEGION D'HONNEUR AWARD FOR D-DAY VETERANS
http://support.britishlegion.org.uk/app/answers/detail/a_id/1308/~/legion-dhonneur-award-for-d-day-veterans

attributes.action: Put more pressure on people and other countries to cut global warming
attributes.background: I understand that the government is already trying to cut down global warming but I still don't believe everything is being done. The purpose of a government is to better our future by learning from what has gone wrong. Flooding will increase with global warming, as will the cost of flood repairs..
attributes.additional_details: Sea levels are set to rise by twice as much as anticipated by the end of this century, showing that we are not prepared for the extent of the problems that this on going issue will create. The record for the lowest area of ice coverage in the Arctic is set to happen either this year or next year which creates yet another issue for our wildlife, which has been ignored because we rank the life of an endangered animal that doesn't contribute to pollution lower than our own.

attributes.action: Make 'motorway driving' lessons a mandatory part of the driving license test
attributes.background: The current driving license has no complete section on motorway driving and only includes them within 'Pass Plus'. Motorway driving and motorway etiquette are an invaluable part of driving as a whole and it should be mandatory for motorway lessons for drivers.
attributes.additional_details: The number of large scale roads are increasing dramatically in the UK and with no real lessons or real time motorway education, new drivers enter motorways, sometimes without driving on them ever before. The rules of motorway driving need to be taught to all new drivers. Motorways are a very dangerous place and it is unfair to send a new driver out onto one without them having any previous motorway lessons.

attributes.action: Bring back maintenance grant for 2016?
attributes.background: After this rise of tution fees to 9000 students already going to be in a debt of 18000. If you scrap maintenance grant then thats double debt every year making the debt nearly 32000 this putting of students for going into higher education and those who do will be I debt for most of life.

attributes.action: Stop Privatisation Public Transport and British Business
attributes.background: All Business and Transport should be handed back to the Government including Great Western Railways as Trains including buses will be cheaper for the public to buy tickets. Also British Gas and other Business which were owned by the government to be re instated also to reduce Air Passenger Tax....
attributes.additional_details: On Long haul Flights.

attributes.action: Category D (bus) license holders to be upgraded to class 2 license for free.
attributes.background: Due to the similar size of vehicles and weight of vehicles category D (bus) show be allowed to drive class 2 vehicles.

attributes.action: Amend the law on stamp duty on your main residence when you own a second home
attributes.background: If you cohabit and separate and want to transfer the main residence to your sole name you have to pay 3% stamp duty on your equity share coupled with your portion of any remaining mortgage when you own a second property.  This law does not apply if you are married so discriminates people cohabiting.
attributes.additional_details:
Stamp duty was paid when the house was originally purchased so how can you pay this again when you are not moving?
Why does the rule not apply if you were to sell the property?
Why does being married mean you are exempt?
The revenue state this is because you are increasing your share of property you own?
Surely the additional stamp duty should only be on the increase in market value/equity of the property over and above what you originally paid?

attributes.action: Remove the NHS from goverment control and let it be independently run by experts
attributes.background: take the NHS out of direct government control and allow experts i.e doctors, nurses etc to have a say and run it properly without interference and micro management from Government health secretary Jeremy Hunt

attributes.action: Increase SFE loan for volunteer placement year students in the UK
attributes.background: SFE is there to help students afford their university studies, however the amount offered for a volunteer (unpaid) placement year is considerably lower, making it hard for students to afford living costs. Universities are pushing for students to take placement years yet SFE is making it unaffordable
attributes.additional_details:
Universities and SFE offer varying amounts ranging from £2000 to £2500. According to the NUS average living costs for a student in the UK is £13,388 for living costs
(£6,143 for rent, £1,956 for food, £316 for household goods, £65 for insurance, £2,074 for personal items, £1,524 for travel and £1,310 for leisure).

attributes.action: Make schools more about learning and less about exams
attributes.background: Far too many children are not reaching their potential in schools because they're only rewarded using exams. This isn't the right method of assessment for everyone. Instead, coursework, participation marks and other such methods of assessment should be used to give a more rounded education.

attributes.action: Vendors withdrawing from sales should incur penalties to cover purchasers costs.
attributes.background:
Because of our Vendors decision to withdraw the sale of his property on the day of exchange, we have incurred searches costs,  legal and surveyors fees and now rental costs while we find another property.
We felt obliged to continue, our buyers are due to become parents.

attributes.action: Change the Childcare Act and enable childcare vouchers to be given for relatives
attributes.background: The Department For Education (DFE) allows some parents to claim free childcare for 2 years and for all 3 year olds. At the moment a relative of the child cannot claim this free childcare even if they are an approved childcare provider.
attributes.additional_details: According to the Childcare Act 2006 Childcare is deemed as care for a child that is not provided by a relative. There are many registered childminders who look after their relatives and therefore cannot claim the 15 hours free childcare. However if the child goes to a nursery where a relative works they are allowed to claim free childcare. If a childcare provider is registered and looking after a relative they should be entitled to claim for the free vouchers.

attributes.action: Child Maintenance Options(CSA) to charge a one off fee instead of monthly fees
attributes.background: I feel parents are penalised if they cant work together they shouldn't have to pay continual fees in order to have help in receiving the financial assistance for their child. An initial larger one off payment would be better.When deducting fees monthly the kids are losing out long term its not fair.
attributes.additional_details: I understand that a fee will have to be charged as alot of work goes in to setting up the case but an initial one off fee will be better to help cover the costs.Alot of parents cant work together for a range of reasons including domestic violence,why should our children pay the price of them not being able to work together,they lose out receiving less funds towards their upbringing and quality of life.A one off larger fee should be done to start a new case and carry on maintaining existing ones

attributes.action: Overseas Aid should be a voluntary opt in contribution collected via HMRC.
attributes.background: It is funded via my taxes and much of it is being fraudulently used by corrupt regimes such as those Mr Cameron named. The people of this country have the right to expect its elected representatives to spend taxes on their needs particularly on  defence of the realm.

attributes.action: Standardize the delay repay system formula across all train franchises.
attributes.background: Not all train companies pay out the same percentage compensation per journey for delayed/cancelled trains to season ticket holders. Southeastern divide the amount by 546 journeys a year yet Southern divide the cost by 464 journeys a year. All train companies should have to follow the same formula.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.southeasternrailway.co.uk/contact-us/delay-repay/more-information/ - Annual season ticket counts as 1/546.

http://www.southernrailway.com/your-journey/passengers-charter/ - On the passenger charter leaflet an annual season ticket counts as 1/464.

attributes.action: Stop Special Advisers for family members of Government Ministers and MP's
attributes.background: Special advisers should be be carefully scrutinised by the Parliamentary, expense standards  IPSA and should not be afforded to family members
attributes.additional_details: Recently the PM's wife was afforded the luxury of a fashion guru at the expense of the tax payer to the tune of £53,000

attributes.action: Make it law that you have to have a license to own an axe.
attributes.background: Today a police officer was attacked by someone with an axe.  Why are there not rules for people to own such an offensive weapon.  They are more deadly than firearms, they are silent and can be weilded indiscriminately.

attributes.action: Increase Maritime patrols / air surveillance at sea to protect the UK
attributes.background: Not enough patrol boats or air surveillance re intelligence and prevent terriosts traveling across the English Channel to gain entry into the UK.   Only five patrol boats currently. I reference 15/04/16 two Iranian men called 999 whilst floating in a small rubber boat in the sea

attributes.action: Reduce our foreign aid budget to that of the average of the 50 richest countries
attributes.background: We contribute more than any other nation other than the US. Who even they pay less than we pay taking in %GDP and per head of population.

attributes.action: make it illegal for fast food outlets to sell chicken on the bone
attributes.background: I live near several fast food outlets, people keep throwing their chicken bones on the street. I try my best but my dog keeps finding and eating them. He being sick and it had blood in and having a number 2 with blood in most recently. I'm worried this will end up killing him.

attributes.action: For the UK Government to gift Uganda a new Radiotherapy machine.
attributes.background: Uganda's only radiotherapy machine is broken beyond repair. Mulago Hospital, in the capital city of  Kampala, receives around 44,000 new referrals each year from neighbouring countries. Around 75% of these patients require this form of treatment. Their machine was second hand in the first instance.

attributes.action: The NHS to provide meals for staff, including staff at Queen's Medical Centre.
attributes.background: I want the NHS to provide meals for the staff at queens medical centre including agency staff that work at qmc. The staff work hard everyday and do not get a option whether they would like a meal, I'm writing this petition to ask you to get the nhs to provide meals for staff at the qmc.
attributes.additional_details: At the present moment if the staff at the queens medical centre eat the hospital food they get fired instantly, At fast food places such as McDonald's, burger king ect the staff get free meals, meanwhile the staff at queens medical centre save people lives everyday and they don't get the option. I would like the nhs to provide ethier free meals for the hospital staff or charge £1.00 per meal as they deserve it.

attributes.action: Make social networks more responsible by verifying its users.
attributes.background: Social networks like Facebook don't allow anyone below the age of 18 to join their website. However, there is no verification process in place to enforce this. Profiles can be faked easily. Underage registration and exposure to all sorts of things - good and bad (mostly) is common.
attributes.additional_details:
This is resulting in all sorts of social problems that we are seeing every now and then - 

Getting influenced by terrorists
Getting bullied
etc

Age verification should be enforced legally to avoid fake profiles. Facebook, for example, can link to credit reference agencies to verify identity and age. Such information should be visible on friends and "friend requests".

Facebook penetrates our lives very intimately and is not a virtual world anymore that can stay unregulated.

attributes.action: Stop armed forces recruiting in schools and lift joining age from 16 to 18.
attributes.background: Stop the armed forces from recruiting in schools and change the joining age from 16 to 18

attributes.action: Drug test all politicians.
attributes.background: Following the Psychoactive substances bill of 2015, we respectfully ask that all Members of the houses of parliament both elected and unelected practice what they preach. We therefore call for compulsory drug testing of all members, and their removal from office should they fail.

attributes.action: Bring more awareness and raise more money towards Dementia Researching
attributes.background: I believe that not enough people are aware of how badly Dementia is becoming. 1 in 3 people over 65 will die with dementia. 850, 000 were diagnosed with dementia in 2015. Researchers are still unaware of the proper causes and require more money to extend research and medical help, so help raise it.
attributes.additional_details: Visit: https://www.alzheimers.org.uk/statistics and https://www.alzheimers.org.uk/site/scripts/documents_info.php?documentID=535&pageNumber=2 for more information.

attributes.action: Redirect funds from accommodation of increasing road traffic to its reduction
attributes.background: Road traffic in the UK, similarly to many other countries around the world, is drastically increasing and causing irreparable global damage. We need to redirect funding of roadworks which seek to accommodate the increase, to funding of mass infrastructure allowing people cheap and efficient travel.
attributes.additional_details:
Electric bullet trains currently operational in parts of Asia are cheap, fast, eco-friendly and efficient. In the UK, infrastructure is an embarrassment which costs our pockets and the environment dearly. 

With investment in mass infrastructure development, we no longer allow the urgent concerns over CO2 emissions to be in the hands of time-restricted car consumers and money-hungry suppliers and, instead, raise this issue to the level of a national emergency.

attributes.action: Cameron to openly support the Kurdish people and sanction Turkish goverment.
attributes.background: The Turkish Goverment continues to attack the Kurdish people and course servier Human Rights abuse. We the undersigned feel that the UK goverment should applie sanctions on the Turkish Goverment untill these attacks stop.

attributes.action: Equal rights for ex-Students who took out a Student Loan before 2006.
attributes.background: If you took out a Student Loan before 2006 and don't earn enough to pay it back, it stays with you with amassing interest until your 65th Birthday. If you took your loan out after 2006 it's written off after 25 years or when you're about 46 years old. This is unfair and ageist, equal rights now!!
attributes.additional_details: http://www.slc.co.uk/services/loan-repayment/loan-cancellation.aspx

attributes.action: Use the sugar tax to heavily subsidise or make fitness activities free in the UK
attributes.background: The goverment keeps reminding us about obesity & how we should become more active well wouldnt it be better if the sugar tax was used to heavily subsidise sometimes expensive Gym, fitness activities and so give people incentives to become more active and in turn this could take pressure off the NHS

attributes.action: Make Gift Aid, transparent and accountable to the general public
attributes.background:
Gift Aid accounts for over £4 billion a year in government subsidy to
registered charities in the United Kingdom. This payment is neither
transparent nor able to be scruitinised by the general public.
attributes.additional_details: A recent FOI (Freedom of Information) request to the Treasury regarding Gift Aid was not possible, even by going through official channels (including through my local Member of Parliament). This petition is to open up the Gift Aid Mechanism to greater transparency, ensuring the destination(s) and amount(s) of this effective Government subsidy, is made readily available to the general public, enabling greater scrutiny of these funds and the organisations which receive this funding.

attributes.action: Confiscate the mobile phones of drivers caught using one whilst driving.
attributes.background: Give the police the power to confiscate the mobile phones of drivers caught using one whilst driving. (Not hands free). This will be more of a deterrent than any fines, cautions or points.

attributes.action: Spend more money on United Learning to save our children's education.
attributes.background: United Learning are struggling to keep good qualified teachers such as a member of the KBA Geography department because they can't afford to out pay other schools so children's education may suffer if amazing teachers such as he who is mentioned above are lost to schools without a proper curriculum.
attributes.additional_details: We think the government should pay United Learning more funds to preserve the next generation's education. This means that more children will be drawn to technology to try and replace the awful replacement teachers and therefore damaging their chances of a good education and furthermore a good life.
